In India there is an enormous gap between healthcare supply and demand. What do you think are the major steps that can be taken by the government to improve patient care in the country? 

1. As India is a country with large population and it is a developing country which is attracting the foreigners to enter into our country. 

2. It stands in the second place in terms of population.As there is a huge demand for the health care industry but unfortunately the supply is very less than the requirement.

3. Also India is a mixed economy which is combination of both public sector and private sector. The government should implement certain programmes that should facilitate better care for the patients in the country.

 4.Hospitals should be constructed for each and every village. Proper food should be supplied to the Anganvadi schools. Not only supplying should monitor whether the healthy food is given to the children or not.

5. To prevent many harmful diseases like Swine flue, Chickenpox, Malaria, Polio AIDS, etc., the government should provide vaccines to the people.

6. government should also take care about whether the hospitals are having basic facilities for the patients or not. Based on the population the government should make the policies to supply the healthcare services to the people on and below the poverty line.

7. The people should be informed to get aware of the diseases which are entering into our country in order to avoid the increase rate of patients in the economy. 

8. Now the world became the global economy as a result of trade, investments, business relationships, foreign direct investments etc., more multi-speciality hospitals came into existence with latest equipments following speedy procedures for treatments and fast recovery of patients.

9. But the normal people cannot afford to go to such super-speciality hospitals as their living standards are low. So the government should give some kind of free treatments up to some limited extent based on the kind of disease and the severity of the problems facing by the patients.

10. The pregnant women are to be given some free food and medicines till their delivery in order to give birth to a healthy baby, so that we can avoid diseases in advance.

11. The  problems facing by the people who are unable to receive the services should be informed and be given proper services to them. The healthcare services are to be provided for the people in the every corner of the villages in the country.

12. India should maintain the international standards in providing the healthcare services to the people.

13. Proper services should be offered to the patients for the sake of India to be a healthy country which can become one of the most powerful and developed countries in the world.

14. The main problem is that the supply is less than that of the requirement i.e., demand , the above mentioned are some of the steps which are to be followed in my point of view as per my knowledge.
